info.title: Slicebox API
info.description: Slicebox - safe sharing of medical images

tags.name: General
tags.description: General routes applicable to multiple aspects of the slicebox API and to the slicebox system

tags.name: Import
tags.description: Methods for handling structured importing of DICOM files into slicebox

tags.name: Meta Data
tags.description: Methods for handling DICOM meta data (attributes)

tags.name: Anonymization
tags.description: Methods concerning anonymization and de-anonymization of images and the associated anonymization data

tags.name: Boxes
tags.description: Methods for handling box-to-box connections and issuing box commands

tags.name: Transactions
tags.description: Methods for handling box-to-box transactions of images (primarily for internal slicebox use)

tags.name: SCPs
tags.description: Methods for handling DICOM storage class providers for receiving images from PACS

tags.name: SCUs
tags.description: Methods for handling DICOM storage class users for sending images to PACS

tags.name: Directories
tags.description: Methods for handling watch directories for importing images stored as files

tags.name: Forwarding
tags.description: Methods for handling forwarding rules for automatically forwarding image data from sources to destinations.

tags.name: Series Types
tags.description: Methods for defining and handling series types

tags.name: Logs
tags.description: Methods for handling slicebox system log messages

get.description: Returns a list of currently available data sources. Possible source types are user - data imported by an API call by a user, box - data received from a remote box, directory - data imported via a watched directory, import - data imported into slicebox using import sessions, or scp - data received from a PACS.
Returns a list of currently available destinations. Possible destinations are box - sending data to a remote box, and scu - sending data a receiving SCP.

post.description: stop and shut down slicebox

get.description: No-op route for checking whether the service is alive or not

200.description: The service is up and running

get.description: Returns a list of available import sessions.

parameters.name: startindex
parameters.description: start index of returned slice of import sessions

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: size of returned slice of import sessions

post.description: create a new import sessions

parameters.name: import session
parameters.description: The import session to create containing the user defined name of the session

get.description: Returns the import sessions with the supplied ID

200.description: the import session with the supplied ID

delete.description: deletes the import session with the supplied ID

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of import session to delete

post.description: add a DICOM dataset to the import session with the supplied ID

parameters.name: dataset
parameters.description: The dataset file

200.description: meta data for the imported dataset on the image level of the DICOM hierarchy. Status code 200 signifies that this image was already present in the slicebox database.

201.description: meta data for the imported dataset on the image level of the DICOM hierarchy

get.description: get the imported images corresponding to the import session with the supplied ID

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of import session

200.description: images corresponding to the specified import session

get.description: Returns a list of metadata on the patient level of the DICOM hierarchy

parameters.name: startindex
parameters.description: start index of returned slice of patients

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: size of returned slice of patients

parameters.name: orderby
parameters.description: patient property to order results by

parameters.name: orderascending
parameters.description: order result ascendingly if true, descendingly otherwise

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: filter the results by matching substrings of patient properties against this value

parameters.name: sources
parameters.description: filter the results by matching on one or more underlying series sources. Examples of sources are user, box, directory or scp. The list of sources to filter results by must have the form TYPE1:ID1,TYPE2:ID2,...,TYPEN:IDN. For instance, the argument sources=box:1,user:5 shows results either sent from (slice)box with id 1 or uploaded by user with id 5.

parameters.name: seriestypes
parameters.description: filter the results by matching on one or more underlying series types. The supplied list of series types must be a comma separated list of series type ids. For instance, the argument seriestypes=3,7,22 shows results including series assigned to either of the series types with ids 3, 7 and 22.

parameters.name: seriestags
parameters.description: filter the results by matching on one or more underlying series tags. The supplied list of series tags must be a comma separated list of series tag ids. For instance, the argument seriestags=6,2,11 shows results including series with either of the series tags with ids 6, 2 and 11.

post.description: submit a query for patients

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: parameters of patient query

get.description: Return the patient with the supplied ID

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of patient

get.description: Returns all images for the patient with the supplied patient ID

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of patient

parameters.name: sources
parameters.description: filter the results by matching on one or more series sources. Examples of sources are user, box, directory or scp. The list of sources to filter results by must have the form TYPE1:ID1,TYPE2:ID2,...,TYPEN:IDN. For instance, the argument sources=box:1,user:5 shows results either sent from (slice)box with id 1 or uploaded by user with id 5.

parameters.name: seriestypes
parameters.description: filter the results by matching on one or more series types. The supplied list of series types must be a comma separated list of series type ids. For instance, the argument seriestypes=3,7,22 shows series assigned to either of the series types with ids 3, 7 and 22.

parameters.name: seriestags
parameters.description: filter the results by matching on one or more series tags. The supplied list of series tags must be a comma separated list of series tag ids. For instance, the argument seriestags=6,2,11 shows series with either of the series tags with ids 6, 2 and 11.

parameters.name: sources
parameters.description: filter the results by matching on one or more underlying series sources. Examples of sources are user, box, directory or scp. The list of sources to filter results by must have the form TYPE1:ID1,TYPE2:ID2,...,TYPEN:IDN. For instance, the argument sources=box:1,user:5 shows results either sent from (slice)box with id 1 or uploaded by user with id 5.

parameters.name: seriestypes

For instance, the argument seriestypes=3,7,22 shows results including series assigned to either of the series types with ids 3, 7 and 22.

parameters.name: seriestags
parameters.description: filter the results by matching on one or more underlying series tags. The supplied list of series tags must be a comma separated list of series tag ids. For instance, the argument seriestags=6,2,11 shows results including series with either of the series tags with ids 6, 2 and 11.

parameters.name: sources
parameters.description: filter the results by matching on one or more series sources. Examples of sources are user, box, directory or scp. The list of sources to filter results by must have the form TYPE1:ID1,TYPE2:ID2,...,TYPEN:IDN. For instance, the argument sources=box:1,user:5 shows results either sent from (slice)box with id 1 or uploaded by user with id 5.

parameters.name: seriestypes
parameters.description: filter the results by matching on one or more series types. The supplied list of series types must be a comma separated list of series type ids. For instance, the argument seriestypes=3,7,22 shows series assigned to either of the series types with ids 3, 7 and 22.

parameters.name: seriestags
parameters.description: filter the results by matching on one or more series tags. The supplied list of series tags must be a comma separated list of series tag ids. For instance, the argument seriestags=6,2,11 shows series with either of the series tags with ids 6, 2 and 11.

parameters.name: sources

The list of sources to filter results by must have the form TYPE1:ID1,TYPE2:ID2,...,TYPEN:IDN. For instance, the argument sources=box:1,user:5 shows results either sent from (slice)box with id 1 or uploaded by user with id 5.

get.description: Return the image with the supplied ID

get.description: Returns a list of flattened metadata on the patient, study and series levels

parameters.name: startindex
parameters.description: start index of returned slice of flat series

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: size of returned slice of flat series

parameters.name: orderby
parameters.description: flat series property to order results by

parameters.name: orderascending
parameters.description: order result ascendingly if true, descendingly otherwise

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: filter the results by matching substrings of flat series properties against this value

parameters.name: sources
parameters.description: filter the results by matching on one or more series sources. Examples of sources are user, box, directory or scp. The list of sources to filter results by must have the form TYPE1:ID1,TYPE2:ID2,...,TYPEN:IDN. For instance, the argument sources=box:1,user:5 shows results either sent from (slice)box with id 1 or uploaded by user with id 5.

parameters.name: seriestypes
parameters.description: filter the results by matching on one or more series types. The supplied list of series types must be a comma separated list of series type ids. For instance, the argument seriestypes=3,7,22 shows series assigned to either of the series types with ids 3, 7 and 22.

parameters.name: seriestags
parameters.description: filter the results by matching on one or more series tags. The supplied list of series tags must be a comma separated list of series tag ids. For instance, the argument seriestags=6,2,11 shows series with either of the series tags with ids 6, 2 and 11.

get.description: Return the flat series with the supplied ID

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of flat series

post.description: submit a query for flat series

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: parameters of flat series query

post.description: add a DICOM dataset to slicebox

parameters.name: dataset
parameters.description: The dataset file

200.description: meta data for added dataset on the image level of the DICOM hierarchy. Status code 200 signifies that this image was already present in the slicebox database.

201.description: meta data for added dataset on the image level of the DICOM hierarchy

post.description: add a JPEG image to slicebox. The image data will be wrapped in a DICOM file and added as a new series belonging to the study with the supplied ID

parameters.name: studyid
parameters.description: ID of study to add new series to

parameters.name: jpeg bytes
parameters.description: The jpeg image data

201.description: meta data for added dataset on the image level of the DICOM hierarchy

get.description: fetch dataset corresponding to the supplied image ID

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of image

404.description: if no image was found for the supplied image ID

delete.description: Delete the image with the supplied ID

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of image

post.description: bulk delete a sequence of images according to the supplied image IDs. This is the same as a sequence of DELETE requests to /images/{id}

parameters.name: image IDs
parameters.description: IDs of images to delete

get.description: list all DICOM attributes of the dataset corresponding to the supplied image ID

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of image

404.description: if no image was found for the supplied image ID

get.description: get basic information about the pixel data of an image

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of image

200.description: basic information about the pixeldata of an image

404.description: if no image was found for the supplied image ID

get.description: get a PNG image representation of the image corresponding to the supplied ID

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of image

parameters.name: framenumber
parameters.description: frame/slice to show

parameters.name: windowmin
parameters.description: intensity window minimum value. If not specified or set to zero, windowing will be selected from relevant DICOM attributes

parameters.name: windowmax
parameters.description: intensity window maximum value. If not specified or set to zero, windowing will be selected from relevant DICOM attributes

parameters.name: imageheight
parameters.description: height of PNG image. If not specified or set to zero, the image height will equal that of the data

404.description: if no image was found for the supplied image ID

put.description: delete the selected image and replace it with an anonymized version

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of image to anonymize

parameters.name: tag values
parameters.description: specification of values for anonymous DICOM attributes

404.description: image or corresponding dataset not found

post.description: get an anonymized version of the image with the supplied ID

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of image for which to get anonymized dataset

parameters.name: tag values
parameters.description: specification of values for anonymous DICOM attributes

404.description: if no image was found for the supplied image ID

post.description: create an export set, a group of image IDs of images to export. The export set will contain the selected images. The export set is available for download 12 hours before it is automatically deleted.

parameters.name: image ids
parameters.description: ids of images to export

201.description: if the supplied list of image ids is empty or no if images could be found

200.description: ID of created export set. To be used with the associated GET method for downloading.

get.description: download the export set with the supplied export set ID as a zip archive

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of export set to download

post.description: anonymize the images corresponding to the supplied list of image IDs (each paired with a list of DICOM tag translation). This route corresponds to repeated use of the route /images/{id}/anonymize.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: parameters of anonymization key query

200.description: the list of newly created anonymous images

get.description: get a list of anonymization keys, each specifying how vital DICOM attributes have been anonymized for a particular image

parameters.name: startindex
parameters.description: start index of returned slice of anonymization keys

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: size of returned slice of anonymization keys

parameters.name: orderby
parameters.description: property to order results by

parameters.name: orderascending
parameters.description: order result ascendingly if true, descendingly otherwise

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: filter the results by matching substrings of properties against this value

200.description: anonymization keys, one per DICOM image

get.description: get the anonymization key with the supplied ID

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of anonymization key

200.description: anonymization key for the supplied ID

404.description: if no anonymization key could be found for the supplied ID

delete.description: delete an anonymization key that is no longer of interest

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of anonymization key

get.description: get pointers to the images corresponding to the anonymization key with the supplied ID

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of anonymization key

200.description: an array of pointers each containing an image ID corresponding to the anonymization key for the supplied ID

404.description: if no anonymization key could be found for the supplied ID

post.description: submit a query for anonymization keys

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: parameters of anonymization key query

post.description: Obtain a session cookie that can be used to authenticate future API calls from the present IP address and with the present user agent.

parameters.name: UserPass
parameters.description: username and password for user logging in

201.description: if the supplied credentials are valid. The response headers will contain Set-Cookie.

401.description: if the supplied credentials are invalid.

post.description: Logout the current user by responding with a delete cookie header removing the session cookie for this user.

get.description: obtain information on the currently logged in user as specified by the supplied session cookie, IP address and user agent.

404.description: no user found for the supplied session cookie, IP address and user agent, or if any of the required headers are missing.

get.description: Returns all users of slicebox

parameters.name: startindex
parameters.description: start index of returned slice of users

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: size of returned slice of users

post.description: Creates a new user. Dupicates are accepted but not added.

parameters.name: user
parameters.description: User to add

delete.description: deletes a single user based on the ID supplied

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of user to delete

get.description: get a list of slicebox log messages

parameters.name: startindex
parameters.description: start index of returned slice of log messages

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: size of returned slice of log messages

parameters.name: subject
parameters.description: log subject to filter results by

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: log type (DEFAULT, INFO, WARN, ERROR) to filter results by

delete.description: Delete the log entry with the supplied ID

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of log entry

get.description: get a list of box connections

parameters.name: startindex
parameters.description: start index of returned slice of boxes

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: size of returned slice of boxes

post.description: create a new box connection where the supplied entity holds the remote box name. Used by publicly available boxes.

parameters.name: remoteBoxName
parameters.description: name of box to connect (and send URL) to

post.description: connect to another box using a received URL. Used to connect to a public box.

parameters.name: remoteBox
parameters.description: remote box to connect with

delete.description: Delete the remote box with the supplied ID

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of box to remove

post.description: send images corresponding to the supplied image ids to the remote box with the supplied ID

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of box to send images to

parameters.name: sequence of image tag values
parameters.description: specification of which images to send and list of DICOM attribute values to use in anonymized datasets

get.description: get incoming transactions (finished, currently receiving, waiting or failed)

parameters.name: startindex
parameters.description: start index of returned slice of transactions

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: size of returned slice of transactions

200.description: incoming transactions, sorted from most to least recently updated

delete.description: delete an incoming transaction. If a currently active transaction is deleted, a new transaction with the remainder of the images is created when receiving the next incoming image.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of incoming transaction

get.description: get the received images corresponding to the incoming transaction with the supplied ID

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of incoming transaction

200.description: images received corresponding to the specified incoming transaction

get.description: get outgoing transactions (finished, currently sending, waiting or failed)

parameters.name: startindex
parameters.description: start index of returned slice of transactions

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: size of returned slice of transactions

200.description: outgoing transactions, finished, sending, waiting or failed

delete.description: delete an outgoing transaction. This will stop ongoing transactions.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of outgoing transaction

get.description: get the sent images corresponding to the outgoing transaction with the supplied ID

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of outgoing transaction

200.description: images sent corresponding to the specified outgoing transaction

post.description: add an image (dataset) as part of a transaction. This method is used when sending images using the push method to a public slicebox.

parameters.name: token
parameters.description: authentication token identifying the current box-to-box connection

parameters.name: transactionid
parameters.description: the ID of the client's outgoing transaction

parameters.name: sequencenumber
parameters.description: the index of this image in the transaction

parameters.name: totalimagecount
parameters.description: the total number of images in this transaction

parameters.name: dataset
parameters.description: the dataset byte array

get.description: get next outgoing transaction and image (information on the next image that the connected box wishes to send to you), if any. This method is used when sending images using the poll method from a public slicebox.

parameters.name: token
parameters.description: authentication token identifying the current box-to-box connection

200.description: next outgoing transaction and image information block

404.description: there are currently no outgoing transactions to fetch for the box connection with the supplied token

get.description: fetch an image from the connected box as part of a transaction. This method is used when sending images using the poll method from a public slicebox.

parameters.name: token
parameters.description: authentication token identifying the current box-to-box connection

parameters.name: transactionid
parameters.description: the ID of the outgoing transaction

parameters.name: imageid
parameters.description: the ID of the outgoing transaction image

404.description: no outgoing trensaction and/or image found for the supplied transaction id and transaction image id

post.description: signal that the supplied outgoing transaction and image was successfully received and can be marked as sent. This method is used when sending images using the poll method from a public slicebox.

parameters.name: token
parameters.description: authentication token identifying the current box-to-box connection

parameters.name: outgoing entry and image information block
parameters.description: outgoing transaction and image that has been successfully received

post.description: signal that the image corresponding to the supplied outgoing transaction and image could not be read or stored properly on the receiving side, and that the transaction should be marked as failed.

parameters.name: token
parameters.description: authentication token identifying the current box-to-box connection

parameters.name: outgoing transaction and image, and error message
parameters.description: the outgoing transaction and image information block corresponding to the failed image transfer, along with the associated error message

get.description: get a list of watch directories. Each watch directory and its sub-directories are watched for incoming DICOM files, which are read and imported into slicebox.

parameters.name: startindex
parameters.description: start index of returned slice of watched directories

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: size of returned slice of watched directories

post.description: add a new directory to watch for incoming DICOM files

parameters.name: watchedDirectory
parameters.description: directory to setup a watch for. The ID property is irrelevant, the ID of the inserted record is present in the returned data.

delete.description: stop watching and remove the directory corresponding to the supplied ID

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: id of directory to stop watching

get.description: get a list of DICOM SCPs. Each SCP is a server for receiving DICOM images from e.g. a PACS system.

parameters.name: startindex
parameters.description: start index of returned slice of SCPs

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: size of returned slice of SCPs

post.description: add a new SCP for receiving DICOM images

parameters.name: scp
parameters.description: SCP information. The ID property is irrelevant, the ID of the inserted record is present in the returned data.

400.description: Invalid port number or AE title

delete.description: shut down and remove the SCP corresponding to the supplied ID

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: id of SCP to remove

get.description: get a list of DICOM SCUs. Each SCU is a client for sending DICOM images to an SCP, e.g. a PACS system.

parameters.name: startindex
parameters.description: start index of returned slice of SCUs

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: size of returned slice of SCUs

post.description: add a new SCU for sending DICOM images

parameters.name: scu
parameters.description: SCU information. The ID property is irrelevant, the ID of the inserted record is present in the returned data.

400.description: Invalid port number or AE title

delete.description: remove the SCU corresponding to the supplied ID

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: id of SCU to remove

post.description: send the images with the supplied image IDs to a DICOM SCP using the the SCU with the supplied scu ID

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: id of SCU to use for sending

parameters.name: imageids
parameters.description: array of ids of images to send

404.description: Series not found or SCU not found

get.description: get a list of all added series types. By filtering search results for certain series types, it is easier for applications to ensure that they read images of applicable types.

parameters.name: startindex
parameters.description: start index of returned slice of series types

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: size of returned slice of series types

post.description: add a new series type

parameters.name: SeriesType
parameters.description: Series type information. The ID property is irrelevant, the ID of the inserted record is present in the returned data.

put.description: request an asynchronous update of all series, labelling appropriate series with the series type corresponding to the supplied ID.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: id of series type to update series labels for

204.description: update successfully added to queue of series type updates

delete.description: remove the series type corresponding to the supplied ID

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: id of series type to remove

get.description: get a list of rules for assigning series types to series. A rule connects to a series of attributes with values and a resulting series type. If a series has the required values of the listed attributes, it is assigned to the series type of the rule.

parameters.name: seriestypeid
parameters.description: ID of series type to list rules for

200.description: the list of series type rules for the series type with the supplied ID

post.description: add a new series type rule

parameters.name: SeriesTypeRule
parameters.description: Series type rule information. The ID property is irrelevant, the ID of the inserted record is present in the returned data.

get.description: get the status of the internal process of updating series types for series following a change of series types, rules or attributes.

200.description: a status message, either idle or running.

delete.description: remove the series type rule corresponding to the supplied ID

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: id of series type rule to remove

get.description: get the list of attributes for the series type rule with the supplied ID.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: index of series type rule to list rule attributes for

200.description: the list of series type rule attributes for the series type rule with the supplied ID

post.description: add a new series type rule attribute

parameters.name: SeriesTypeRuleAttribute
parameters.description: Series type rule attribute information. The ID property is irrelevant, the ID of the inserted record is present in the returned data.

201.description: the created series type rule attribute

delete.description: remove the series type rule attribute corresponding to the supplied series type and attribute IDs

parameters.name: ruleId
parameters.description: id of series type rule for which to remove an attribute

parameters.name: attributeId
parameters.description: id of attribute to remove

get.description: get a list of all forwarding rules. A forwarding rule specifies the automatic forwarding of images from a source (SCP, BOX, etc.) to a destimation (BOX, SCU, etc.)

parameters.name: startindex
parameters.description: start index of returned slice of rules

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: size of returned slice of rules

post.description: add a new forwarding rule

parameters.name: FowardingRule
parameters.description: The forwarding rule to add. The ID property is irrelevant, the ID of the inserted record is present in the returned data.

delete.description: remove the forwarding rule corresponding to the supplied ID

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: id of forwarding rule to remove
